verses.verse: (6 Neither doth godliness profit, or ungodliness hurt God, but man.13 The wicked cry unto God and are not heard.) Elihu spake moreover, and said,

Thinkest thou this right, that thou hast said, I am (Job never spake these words: but because he maintained his innocence, it seemed as though he would say, that God tormented him without just cause.) more righteous than God?
For thou hast said, What profiteth it thee, and what availeth it me, to purge me from my sin?
Therefore will I answer thee, and thy (Such as are in the like error.) companions with thee.
Look unto the heaven, and see and behold the (If thou canst not control the clouds, wilt thou presume to instruct God?) clouds which are higher than thou.
If thou sinnest, what doest thou (Neither doth thy sin hurt God, nor thy justice profit him: for he will be glorified without thee.) against him, yea, when thy sins be many, what doest thou unto him?
If thou be righteous, what givest thou unto him? or what receiveth he at thine hand?
Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art: and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.

They cause many that are oppressed, (The wicked may hurt man and cause him to cry, who if he sought to God which sendeth comfort should be delivered.) to cry, which cry out for the violence of the mighty.
But none saith, Where is God that made me, which giveth songs in the night?
Which teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and giveth us more wisdom than the fowls of the heaven.
Then they cry because of the violence of the wicked, (Because they pray not in faith, as feeling Godâ€™s mercies.) but he answereth not.
Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.
Although thou sayest to God, Thou wilt not regard it, (God is just, howsoever thou judgest of him.) yet judgment is before him: trust thou in him.
But now because his anger hath not visited, nor called to count the evil with great extremity,
Therefore Job (For if he did punish thee as thou deservest, thou shouldest not be able to open thy mouth.) openeth his mouth in vain, and multiplieth words without knowledge.
